text: The Dark Knight Trilogy's main reason for its successful was it's villains. Cillian Murphy's "Scarecrow" in Batman Begins Heath Ledger's "Joker" in The Dark Knight (Specially this one) Tom Hardy's "Bane" in The Dark Knight Rises

Scarecrow in the Dark Knight Rises is the judge for death or exile. Imagine if Heath Ledger was still alive while this was filming. I would’ve loved to see him and where the Joker would have been during Bane’s takeover. pic.twitter.com/iHydPM4nRe
That moment when you realize that all of the villains in “The Dark Knight Trilogy” where all actors you love.. Cillian Murphy (Scarecrow) Heath Ledger (Joker) Tom Hardy (Bane)

The Dark Knight trilogy Batman Begins: Cillan Murphy DELIVERED as Scarecrow & it was the beginning of Christian Bale as Batman The Dark Knight: HEATH LEDGER'S JOKER IS ICONIC The Dark Knight Rises: gave us Bane, catwoman, visuals and a PLOT TWIST Christopher Nolan did THAT! https://twitter.com/lunasluvchild/status/945813864716886018 …
The Dark Knight because Heath Ledger's Joker >>> Ra's al Ghul + Scarecrow combined
I really loved Heath Ledger's Joker, but I thought the Dark Knight movies were overrated. I wish Scarecrow had a bigger role
We want the dark knight gear for bane, Batman, scarecrow and a tribute to the heath ledger joker

I think there was going to be a tie-in between the Joker and Scarecrow on the third Dark Knight movie if Heath Ledger hadn't died.
Cillian Murphy's portrayal of The Scarecrow in Batman Begins beats Heath Ledger's Joker in The Dark Knight every time, I'm afraid.

the location of Heath Ledger's Joker in 'The Dark Knight Rises'? the Joker would've been running the villain court instead of Scarecrow.
Cillian Murphy as Scarecrow, Heath Ledger as The Joker, and Tom Hardy as Bane. My absolute favorite Dark Knight Trilogy villains.
After the Scarecrow as the villan in Batman Begins, Nolan stepped it up casting Heath Ledger as the Joker in The Dark Knight.
The only reason Scarecrow was in Dark Knight Rises was because Heath Ledger died... That was supposed to be Joker in the "court scene".
